footer_about_text: A service for easily calculating part-time apprenticeship duration.
footer_disclaimer: Note: the results of this calculator are non-binding and for guidance only.
footer_project_credit: A LAB project within the SEB study program
calc_intro:
Do you want to complete your apprenticeship part-time?
Then you're in the right place.
Find out instantly how long your part-time training will take.
label_fulltime_hours: How many hours per week is full-time training?
info_fulltime_hours: Please enter your company's contractual full-time hours (usually 38-40). This is used to calculate your part-time percentage.
label_parttime_hours: How many hours per week do you want to work part-time?
info_parttime_hours: Enter how many hours per week you want to work part-time. This shows how much longer your training will take.
label_training_duration: How long does your full-time training last?
info_training_duration: Select the usual total duration of your training (e.g. 24, 36 or 42 months as per contract).
question_parttime_start: How would you like to complete your training?
info_parttime_start:
Planning full-time first? Enter the number of those months.
Already worked full-time? Enter the months already completed.
Leave 0 if you start directly part-time.
info_age: If you are over 21 at the start of training, you can often shorten by up to 12 months.
question_school: What is your highest school degree?
info_school: The higher your degree, the more shortening may be possible. Choose the highest degree you hold.
question_experience: Do you have relevant work experience (e.g. internships)?
info_experience: Relevant internships or jobs can be credited if they match the occupation.
question_apprenticeship: Have you already completed relevant vocational training?
info_apprenticeship: A relevant completed apprenticeship can significantly shorten the new one (often up to 12 months).
question_study: Did you attend relevant courses during your studies?
info_study: Relevant university modules (e.g. programming, business) can sometimes be credited.
info_childcare: If you care for children, the chamber can more easily approve part-time training or adjust duration.
question_familycare: Do you care for relatives (e.g. grandparents)?
info_familycare: Regularly caring for relatives (e.g. parents, grandparents) can be considered for part-time training.
result_served_header: Full-time at the start of your training
result_served_copy: These are the months you plan to start full-time before switching to part-time.
result_shortening_copy: All reasons for the shortening are listed here.
result_remaining_copy: This is the remaining duration in full-time.
result_remaining_detail: This is the remaining duration in full-time (after credited reasons and time already served).
result_parttime_copy: Explanation of the part-time adjustment is shown here.
result_parttime_detail_zero: Reducing weekly hours from {full}h to {part}h leads to a minor extension of {grace} months that is often ignored in practice.
result_parttime_detail_extend: Reducing weekly hours from {full}h to {part}h for the remaining duration extends the training by {months} months.
result_early_body: Good performance can enable a shortening of 6 months. The application is made to the competent body (e.g. IHK/HWK) and is independent of the reasons calculated here.
disclaimer_text: The results are for guidance only and create no legal claim.
disclaimer_more: A detailed explanation of the calculation can be found on our page
faq_intro: Here you will find answers to common questions about part-time apprenticeships and shortening the apprenticeship duration. The content gives you a first overview and helps you understand the basics. For detailed information you can also find a link to the Netzwerk Teilzeitausbildung Baden-Württemberg further below.
faq_q1_title: Who can do an apprenticeship part-time?
faq_q1_body:
A part-time apprenticeship offers flexibility when a full-time apprenticeship is not or no longer possible because of your personal situation.

Since 1 January 2020 basically anyone can do a part-time apprenticeship – the requirement is that employer and apprentice agree.

Typical examples:

  • People with childcare responsibilities
  • People who care for relatives
  • People with a disability
  • Refugees who need or want to work alongside the apprenticeship

A retraining can also be done part-time.
faq_q2_body:
Vocational school usually runs the same as in a full-time apprenticeship. The part-time arrangement mainly concerns the working time in the company.

  • The amount of teaching usually stays the same.
  • Separate part-time classes only exist if enough students sign up.
  • In individual cases custom solutions are possible, e.g. if class times do not fit childcare – ask the school.
faq_q3_title: What does the weekly working time look like in part-time?
faq_q3_body:
In part-time the working hours in the company are reduced – not the training content.

  • How many hours per week you work is agreed with your company.
  • The reduction of company hours should generally not exceed 50%.
  • Depending on hours, the total duration can be extended.

A part-time apprenticeship is also possible if the regular duration stays the same – then only the weekly hours are reduced, not the duration.
faq_q4_title: How long does a part-time apprenticeship take?
faq_q4_body:
The goal is always a full qualification equivalent to full-time. Because of fewer hours in the company, the duration can increase.

Examples:

  • Regular 3 years ➜ cut to about 75% hours: 4 years total
  • Regular 3 years ➜ cut to about 50% hours: 4.5 years total

It is also possible to complete within the regular duration under §8 (1) BBiG and fix the end date contractually (possibly with a shortening request to the chamber).
faq_q5_body:
There are several reasons for shortening that can be considered individually or combined (total usually max. 12 months):

  • Family or care duties: up to 12 months
  • Age over 21 (at start): up to 12 months
  • School degree:
    • Intermediate / technical entrance: up to 6 months
    • General university entrance (A-levels): up to 12 months
  • Work experience (completed apprenticeship, relevant basic training or relevant job): up to 12 months

Multiple reasons can be combined, but the sum is capped and the legal minimum duration must not be undercut.
faq_q6_title: How short can an apprenticeship become?
faq_q6_body:
Besides the cap on shortening reasons there are legal minimum durations that cannot be undercut:

  • Regular 3.5 years ➜ minimum 2 years
  • Regular 3 years ➜ minimum 1.5 years
  • Regular 2 years ➜ minimum 1 year

The exact calculation can be done by a calculator or the competent chamber.
faq_q7_body:
Independent of part-time or shortening you can be admitted early to the exam under §45 (1) BBiG. Typical requirements:

  • very good on-the-job performance and company support
  • good school results (e.g. average 2.5 or better in exam subjects)

You need to submit the relevant forms to the competent chamber.
faq_q8_title: Where do I apply for shortening?
faq_q8_body:
The application is always submitted together by you and your company.

Responsible are usually:

  • Chamber of Industry and Commerce (IHK)
  • Chamber of Crafts (HWK)

Ideally apply before the apprenticeship starts. Shortening during the apprenticeship is also possible – ask the chamber.
faq_q9_title: Can I switch between full-time and part-time?
faq_q9_body:
Yes, in many cases a switch is possible:

  • from full-time to part-time if new reasons arise (e.g. child, care)
  • from part-time back to full-time if reasons disappear

The request is always filed with the company to the competent chamber.
faq_q10_title: How is part-time working time distributed?
faq_q10_body:
The exact distribution of working hours is agreed between you and the company. Note:

  • Vocational school time is deducted from weekly hours.
  • The remaining hours are distributed to create useful shifts.
  • In some professions edge hours matter (e.g. Saturday retail, early bakery shifts).
faq_q11_title: Do vacation and pay get reduced?
faq_q11_body:
Vacation entitlement depends on working days per week.

  • Example: 5 days ➜ 30 days, 4 days ➜ 24 days (30 : 5 × 4)

Apprentice pay may be reduced proportionally to hours, but it does not have to be. Many companies still pay full pay so finances work out.

For living costs there are various grants and benefits (e.g. BAB, basic income, housing benefit, parental allowance). Agencies like the Employment Agency or Jobcenter can advise.
faq_more_body:
Detailed information, examples, funding options and counseling on part-time apprenticeship can be found at the Netzwerk Teilzeitausbildung Baden-Württemberg.

➜ To the info page for prospective apprentices

Note: The link leads to an external site with detailed info on funding, counseling and legal basics.
faq_disclaimer: Note: The information on this page is intended to explain part-time and shortening in an easy way. It does not replace official advice by the competent body (e.g. IHK, HWK, Employment Agency or Jobcenter).
how_intro: The Part-Time Apprenticeship Calculator helps you estimate the duration of your apprenticeship – for part-time training and shortening reasons. Here you learn how the calculation works and which rules apply.
how_sources_title: Legal basis and practical info on part-time apprenticeship
how_sources_body: Part-time apprenticeship is regulated in the Vocational Training Act (BBiG), especially §7a (part-time apprenticeship) and §8 (shortening or extension).
how_sources_bbig: ➜ Vocational Training Act (BBiG) – full text and table of contents
how_sources_ihk: ➜ IHK Rhein-Neckar – FAQ on shortening apprenticeship time
how_sources_note: Sources: German Ministry of Justice (gesetze-im-internet.de) and IHK Rhein-Neckar
how_basics_body: The calculator considers different credit reasons (e.g. school degree, experience, care) and legal limits. Each reason can lead to a shortening.
how_basics_tip: Rule of thumb: All selected reasons are first added up to get the potential shortening. This sum is then limited by caps.
how_school_body: Your highest school degree can shorten your apprenticeship:
how_age_body: If you are older than 21 at the start, a 12 month shortening is applied automatically.
how_age_note: Reason: More maturity and life experience.
how_experience_body: If you already have relevant work experience (e.g. internship, EQ) or a completed apprenticeship, you can shorten by 12 months.
how_study_body: Relevant university modules (e.g. in a related field) can provide up to 12 months shortening.
how_family_body: Care for your own children or care for close relatives is recognised and credited with 12 months.
how_caps_intro: The calculator checks two caps. The stricter cap applies.
how_caps_card1_body1: No matter how many reasons you combine: the total credit is never more than 12 months.
how_caps_card2_body: The apprenticeship must not fall below the legal minimum duration.
how_parttime_body: If you do your apprenticeship part-time (fewer weekly hours), the duration extends. The rules:
how_parttime_rule1: Max extension: Total duration at most 1.5× the regular duration.
how_parttime_rule2: Grace period: Extensions up to 6 months are ignored. If the part-time math gives e.g. 3 months, it is set to 0.
how_steps_title: How the calculator works (step by step)
how_step2: Apply cap 1: Limit the sum to max. 12 months.
how_step3: Apply cap 2: Check the legal maximum shortening by minimum duration.
how_step4: Use the smaller of the two values as final shortening.
how_step5: Only after that apply the part-time factor to the new duration.
how_steps_note_q: "Why does the calculator show only 12 months shortening (to 24) for 36 months, although the minimum is 18?"
how_steps_note_body1: That is correct. The calculator only covers credit reasons (cap 1 = 12 months).
how_steps_note_body2: The gap (e.g. the 6 months from 24 to 18) can be achieved by "early admission to the exam" for good performance during the apprenticeship. This is separate and must be requested from the chamber.
how_example_intro: Here is how the rules work together in practice.
how_example_step2_body:
Rule: max. 12 months credit.
18 is too high ➜ capped at 12 months
how_example_result_body:
Extension from 24 to 32 months (+8) is above the 6-month grace period.
Estimated duration: 32 months
how_disclaimer: Note: The results are non-binding and for guidance only. No legal claim can be derived. The final decision is always made by the competent body (e.g. IHK/HWK).

privacy_text_1: Protecting your data is important to us. All inputs you make in this part-time training calculator and the resulting calculation results are stored only temporarily in your browser's session storage.
privacy_point_1: No transmission: Your data is never sent to a server or third parties. All processing happens locally on your device.
privacy_point_2: Automatic deletion: As soon as you close the browser tab or window in which you use the calculator, all your entries and results are automatically and permanently deleted.
privacy_text_3: This short-term storage only ensures that your inputs are kept while you navigate within the page during your current session.
